University of Minnesota
Seoul National University of Korea Cooperative Project
Minneapolis 14
OFFICE OF THE CAMPUS COORDINATOR
January 22, I960
Dr, Harry J# Skomia
President
NAEB
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
Thanks for your memo of January 19, I960. I will be only too
happy to continue as a member of the Publications Committee under
the Chairmanship of Frank Schooley.
I feel, about the proposal for a rotating editorship, that
two slightly better alternatives might be: (l) continue, as in
the past, with a permanent editor and make space for a guest editorial
whenever the permanent Editor was able to solicit a satisfactory
editorial. This guest editorial would be in addition to the regular
editorial. (2) have a permanent editor as in (l) but invite members
to submit editorials and, from time to time, use the Editor*8 space
for one which was felt to be both timely and of high quality.
May I take this, my first opportunity, to congratulate you
upon your election as the first full-time salaried President of
NAEBI You truly deserved this honor and I am sure you will fill
the post with high distinction.
With all good wishes to you and your staff, I am.
Sincerely,
Professor and Coordinator
